page.title: 05Smaden - Ecology 1
page.content: The area has a clay sub-soil with odd outcrops of sand and many ponds. The river Beult, with its willows and water lilies, looks attractive but produces severe floods every 20 years or so. The flood of January 1985 was disastrous for houses in Water Lane and The Street and for the Chequers when the underground drain was blocked by lumps of ice, causing the river to back-up and devastate the area, in spite of firemen working the pumps all night. Dering Wood is a large area of badly neglected woodland with rides overgrown and swampy paths where rhododendrons sprawl around. It is privately owned but crossed by a public footpath, one of many in the area. The County Council should keep these clear and marked but this they often fail to do. A local footpath group tries to preserve this amenity.
